relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
CSU has great security on campus with officers roaming the building daily and patrolling outside as well.
The student center and the main class room buildings are the best places to hang out with friends, studying, or just to grab a bite to eat.
There is always something going on at CSU wether its from greek life, to sporting events, to dances, to just being right in the middle of downtown Cleveland theres always something to do.
The food and Dinning at CSU is great not like regular college dinning is we have great places to eat on and off campus.
I am not sure about the dorm life at Cleveland State because i commute everyday to school.
I can honestly say that i am learning a lot in the class rooms and out the class room at Cleveland State from any other learning institute I've attended.

Three tips i would give prospective students would be one keep track of your syllabus and due dates. second would be get familiar with your professors they are there to help you succeed. Thirdly would be stick with your major i know a lot of time you get into something a class start to get tough and you change your major instead of getting help from professors and tutors but if you keep changing your major you're only going to be in school longer and waste more money doing it.

Cleveland State University is a great learning institute and they are alway improving the campus to make it feel more like a college environment. Cleveland State has some of the toughest professors who want to make sure you are prepared for the real world. Cleveland State has a lot of good support groups and clubs to help you feel more comfortable at the school and making your college experience one to remember.
pageTitle: Cleveland State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

I have mixed feelings about CSU due to my personal academic experiences. I believe that money is more important than the students, at CSU., 478833=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 425748=If you're starting out as a freshman prepare to be in debt! Fall and Spring semesters cost around $5000 for a full-time schedule. That doesn't include books, food, supplies, and every other educational expense. I transferred from a community college where a full-time semester cost about $1200-$1500. CSU also has University partnership programs with some community colleges. You attend CSU classes through the community college and it's cheaper., 219755=The Penthouse 2011-2012}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students -City-lovers -Adventure-lovers -Commuters -Those who want to be close to home Another thing to remember about college - you get out of it what you put in. You make the experience. Tips for prospective students Like stated above, APPLY EARLY for scholarships and to the Honors/Scholars program. I am in the Scholars program and they have lots of counseling and advice available if needed. Just remember this, the faculty at Cleveland State University is ready to help YOU. If any of you have questions, just e-mail/message me and I'll try to help out as best as I can. Good luck with everything! Bang for the buck Other than the school having a great learning environment, it has a lower tuition than most schools out there. While this wasn't the main factor that pulled me into the school, it definitely helps that you and your family won't have to worry as much about getting money for school. On top of that, the scholarships that are available are abundant. One word of advice with all of the scholarships though - APPLY EARLY! Being early with things, especially when it comes to academics, is one of the best things to do. Am enjoying being here
